page.title: 07Forestry
page.content: Aberdeen has for many centuries been associated with Forestry through a Charter dating back to 1313. The City has a Department of Forestry at its University, has an Institute of Soil Research and is the Forestry Commission's East of Scotland Headquarters. { Kirkhill}is a Mature Commission Forest of fairly modest proportions a few miles from Aberdeen, swathing the granite outcrops of Tyrebagger Hill. As well as the eventual harvest of trees - forests provide{shelter, quiet {areas, provide natural habitat for {wildlife and most importantly for a {rural/urban fringe area, it provides {recreational opportunities for such {activities as Forest Walks, Wayfaring {and Orienteering.}
